case_vignette: An 18-year-old man presents to the student health department at his university for recurrent palpitations. The patient had previously presented to the emergency department (ED) for sudden onset palpitations five months ago when he first started college. He had a negative cardiac workup in the ED and he was discharged with a 24-hour Holter monitor which was also negative. He has no history of any medical or psychiatric illnesses. The patient reports that since his initial ED visit, he has had several episodes of unprovoked palpitations associated with feelings of dread and lightheadedness though he cannot identify a particular trigger. Recently, he has begun sitting towards the back of the lecture halls so that he can “quickly escape and not make a scene” in case he gets an episode in class.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having these recurrent episodes where my heart starts beating really fast, and sometimes I feel a sense of dread and become lightheaded.
Could you tell me your age and sex, please?
I'm an 18-year-old man.
Do you have any past medical history, such as heart conditions or thyroid problems?
No, I don't have any history of medical or psychiatric illnesses.
Is there any family history of heart conditions or thyroid problems?
I'm just a patient describing my symptoms; I don't have any additional information about my family history.
Understood. Are you currently taking any medications or supplements?
No, I'm not taking any medications or supplements.
Thank you for the information. Based on the symptoms you've described, it seems like you may be experiencing episodes of **panic attacks**.
